solution_line_template: {lettuce_count} heads of lettuce at ${lettuce_price} apiece is {lettuce_count}*${lettuce_price}=$<<{lettuce_count}*{lettuce_price}={lettuce_total}>>{lettuce_total}.
Thus, each customer purchases ${lettuce_total}+${tomato_total}=$<<{lettuce_total}+{tomato_total}={per_customer_total}>>{per_customer_total} in lettuce and tomatoes per month.

Therefore, if {num_customers} customers per month spend ${per_customer_total} on lettuce and tomatoes, then the store will receive ${per_customer_total}*{num_customers}=$<<{per_customer_total}*{num_customers}={total_sales}>>{total_sales} per month on sales of lettuce and tomatoes.
